result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan Charles Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Portage County case 14CF294.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Evan Charles Beck in court (in custody) with attorney Jayme L. Lehman. 
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea to Count 2. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty regarding Count 2. 
Count 1 is dismissed and read in. 
Court orders sentence withheld, probation 1 year concurrent with Portage County case 14CF294. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
DA Snider indicates he has completed witness notification. 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Cover letter from Atty Jayme Lehman
